definitions: thin stream of liquid flowing slowly and intermittently
gradual movement or arrival of people or things in small numbers
examples: A trickle of water dripped from the leaky faucet constantly
The mountain spring reduced to a trickle during the drought
Only a trickle of customers visited the store today
Information began to trickle out about the merger plans

definitions: person who deceives others through cunning or clever manipulation
mythological or folkloric figure who plays tricks and breaks conventional rules
examples: The trickster conned dozens of elderly people out of their savings
Don't trust that trickster with your credit card information
The coyote appears as a trickster in many Native American stories
Loki serves as the trickster god in Norse mythology

definitions: flag or banner consisting of three distinct colored stripes or sections
any design or object featuring three distinct colors arranged systematically
examples: The French tricolor flies proudly over the embassy building
Students painted their faces with the national tricolor for independence day
The artist created a tricolor pattern using red, white, and blue
Her tricolor scarf matched the flag colors perfectly

definitions: flag or banner consisting of three distinct colored stripes or sections
any design or object featuring three distinct colors arranged systematically
examples: The Indian tricolour represents peace, courage, and prosperity
The tricolour was raised during the national anthem ceremony
The garden featured a tricolour arrangement of tulips
She wore a tricolour ribbon in her hair

definitions: vehicle with three wheels, typically pedal-powered for transportation
child's toy vehicle with three wheels for learning to ride
examples: The vendor pedaled his tricycle loaded with fresh vegetables
Many delivery services in Asia use motorized tricycles
Her toddler loves riding the red tricycle around the backyard
The tricycle helps children develop balance before trying bicycles

definitions: spear or fork with three prongs used for fishing or fighting
three-pronged weapon associated with sea gods in mythology
three-pronged symbol used as emblem or decorative element
examples: The fisherman used a trident to catch large fish
Ancient gladiators sometimes fought with tridents and nets
Neptune carries a golden trident in classical artwork
Poseidon's trident could create earthquakes and storms
The company logo features a stylized trident design
The naval insignia incorporated a silver trident symbol

definitions: event or celebration that occurs every three years
period of three years or lasting for three years
examples: The art triennial attracts visitors from around the world
Our organization holds a triennial conference for members
The triennial report covers fiscal years 2021 through 2023
She received a triennial appointment to the board

definitions: person who keeps trying despite difficulties or setbacks
device or person that tests or evaluates something
examples: She's a real trier who never gives up easily
The coach appreciates triers more than naturally talented quitters
The quality trier inspects every batch before shipment
This electronic trier checks circuit board functionality

definitions: something of little importance or trivial significance
British dessert made with layers of sponge, fruit, custard, and cream
very small amount or degree of something
examples: Don't worry about such trifles when bigger issues need attention
The argument started over a mere trifle
She made a delicious sherry trifle for Christmas dinner
The trifle bowl displayed colorful layers beautifully
Add just a trifle more salt to the soup
He was a trifle annoyed by the interruption

definitions: things or matters of little importance or value
act of treating something as unimportant or wasting time
examples: Stop concerning yourself with such trifling when deadlines approach
His trifling complaints annoyed everyone at the meeting
Her constant trifling prevented any serious work getting done
No more trifling; we need to focus now

definitions: informal term for trigonometry as academic subject
smart and neat in dress or appearance
examples: She struggles with trig but excels at algebra
The trig homework covered sine and cosine functions
He looked very trig in his new uniform
The trig appearance of the shop impressed customers

definitions: lever or mechanism that releases spring to fire weapon
event or circumstance that causes something to happen
stimulus that provokes emotional or psychological response
examples: She squeezed the trigger slowly for better accuracy
The gun's trigger mechanism needs regular maintenance
Rising unemployment could trigger an economic recession
The scandal triggered a major investigation
Loud noises are a trigger for his anxiety attacks
The therapist helped identify her emotional triggers

definitions: branch of mathematics dealing with relationships between angles and sides of triangles
examples: Trigonometry helps engineers calculate distances and angles in construction
Students learn trigonometry after mastering algebra and geometry

definitions: informal term for tricycle, especially child's three-wheeled toy
three-wheeled motorcycle or motorized vehicle
examples: The toddler rode her pink trike around the playground
He bought a trike for his three-year-old daughter
The motorcycle club welcomed riders of trikes and traditional bikes
His custom trike features chrome wheels and leather seats

definitions: agreement or relationship involving three parties or nations
geometric figure or object having three sides
examples: The trilateral trade agreement benefits all three countries
They signed a trilateral defense pact yesterday
The architect designed a trilateral plaza for the building
The trilateral frame provides excellent structural support

definitions: soft felt hat with narrow brim and indented crown
examples: He tipped his trilby hat politely to the ladies
The detective wore a gray trilby and dark overcoat

definitions: rapid alternation between two adjacent musical notes
warbling or quavering sound made by birds or voice
examples: The soprano executed a perfect trill in the aria
Practice your trills slowly before increasing the tempo
The canary's morning trill filled the room with music
She spoke with a delightful trill in her voice

definitions: number equal to one million million or thousand billion depending on system
examples: The national debt exceeds twenty trillion dollars
A trillion seconds equals approximately thirty-two thousand years

definitions: three-petaled woodland flower native to North America and Asia
examples: White trilliums carpet the forest floor each spring
The rare painted trillium grows in shaded mountain areas

definitions: extinct marine arthropod with segmented body that lived during Paleozoic era
examples: The museum displays perfectly preserved trilobite fossils
Trilobites dominated ocean floors for nearly 300 million years

definitions: series of three related books, films, or other creative works
examples: The Lord of the Rings trilogy captivated audiences worldwide
She finally completed her science fiction trilogy last year

definitions: decorative material used as border or edging
act of cutting away excess or unwanted parts
state of physical fitness or proper condition
examples: The dress featured delicate lace trim around the collar
Gold trim adorned the edges of the invitation
The hedge needs a trim before the party
Ask for just a trim at the hair salon
The athlete stays in excellent trim year-round
Keep your sails in proper trim for optimal speed

definitions: sailing vessel with three parallel hulls for stability and speed
examples: The racing trimaran broke several speed records
Their trimaran sailed smoothly through rough waters

definitions: period of three months, especially in pregnancy
academic term lasting approximately three months
examples: Morning sickness usually improves after the first trimester
The second trimester brings increased energy for most women
The university operates on a trimester system
She enrolled for the spring trimester courses

definitions: tool or device used for cutting or trimming edges
person who changes positions to gain advantage
examples: The hedge trimmer makes garden maintenance much easier
Use nail trimmers for precise grooming
That political trimmer switches parties whenever convenient
Don't trust trimmers who change opinions for profit

definitions: decorative materials added to garments or furnishings
pieces cut away during trimming process
examples: The curtains need new trimming to match the decor
Gold trimming enhanced the wedding dress beautifully
Save the trimmings from the roast for making gravy
Grass trimmings can be composted for garden use

definitions: Christian doctrine of God as three persons in one
group or set of three closely related things or people
examples: The Trinity consists of Father, Son, and Holy Spirit
Trinity Sunday celebrates this central Christian doctrine
The trinity of government branches ensures checks and balances
This trinity of factors caused the economic crisis

definitions: group of three musicians or singers performing together
any group or set of three people or things
examples: The jazz trio played at the club every Friday
The string trio performed Mozart beautifully
The trio of friends traveled Europe together
This trio of problems requires immediate attention

definitions: journey or excursion to a place for purpose or pleasure
act of stumbling or losing balance while walking
hallucinogenic drug experience or psychedelic state
examples: Our trip to Japan lasted three wonderful weeks
The business trip included meetings in five cities
His trip over the curb caused a bad ankle sprain
Watch that loose carpet to avoid a trip
The trip lasted hours after taking the mushrooms
Bad trips can cause lasting psychological effects

definitions: edible lining from stomach of ruminant animals used as food
nonsense or worthless talk, ideas, or writing
examples: The restaurant serves traditional tripe soup on Sundays
Properly prepared tripe has a tender, chewy texture
Don't believe that tripe he's spreading about the company
The movie was absolute tripe from start to finish

definitions: amount or number that is three times as large
something consisting of three parts or elements
examples: Sales reached triple their target for the quarter
The recipe calls for triple the usual amount of garlic
He ordered a triple espresso to stay awake
The triple jump requires speed, strength, and technique

definitions: one of three children born at same birth
group or set of three similar things or elements
examples: The triplets celebrated their fifth birthday together
Raising triplets requires tremendous energy and organization
The poem features triplets of rhyming lines
This triplet of notes creates a unique rhythm

definitions: act or process of multiplying by three or becoming three times larger
examples: The tripling of prices caused widespread protests
Tripling our workforce will require more office space

definitions: stand with three legs used to support camera, telescope, or other equipment
examples: The photographer adjusted the tripod for the perfect shot
Use a sturdy tripod for long-exposure night photography

definitions: fine powder made from weathered limestone used for polishing and abrading
examples: The jeweler used tripoli to polish the silver
Tripoli powder creates a high shine on metal surfaces

definitions: person taking short pleasure trip or excursion
person or thing that trips or causes tripping
examples: Day trippers crowded the beach on sunny weekends
The tour bus carried trippers to the castle
That loose board is a real tripper waiting to cause accidents
The tripper mechanism activates the safety switch

definitions: artwork consisting of three panels hinged together or displayed side by side
examples: The medieval triptych depicts scenes from Christ's life
She painted a modern triptych for the gallery exhibition

definitions: mythological Greek sea god with human upper body and fish tail
large marine snail with spiral shell used as trumpet
examples: Triton served as messenger for his father Poseidon
The fountain features a bronze statue of Triton
The triton shell produces a loud sound when blown
Collectors prize the beautiful triton shells

definitions: decisive victory or achievement in battle or competition
feeling of great satisfaction from success or victory
examples: The team celebrated their triumph in the championship
Napoleon's triumph at Austerlitz changed European history
She felt triumph after completing the marathon
His latest novel represents a triumph of imagination

definitions: group of three people sharing power or authority especially in government
examples: The Roman triumvirate divided control of the empire
A triumvirate of executives runs the company

definitions: details, facts, or information of little importance or value
examples: The quiz night focused on movie trivia questions
Don't clutter your presentation with unnecessary trivia

definitions: Russian vehicle drawn by team of three horses abreast
group of three people working together especially in administration
examples: The troika raced across the snowy Russian landscape
Traditional troikas feature elaborate decorations and bells
The troika of leaders negotiated the peace agreement
A troika manages the European bailout program

definitions: malicious computer program disguised as legitimate software
brand name for condoms and sexual health products
examples: The trojan infected thousands of computers before detection
Never download files that might contain trojans
The pharmacy stocks various trojan products
Trojan remains a leading contraceptive brand

definitions: person who posts inflammatory messages online to provoke reactions
ugly cave-dwelling creature from Scandinavian folklore
method of fishing by trailing baited line behind boat
examples: Internet trolls disrupted the forum with offensive comments
Don't feed the trolls by responding to their posts
The story featured a troll living under the bridge
Norse mythology describes trolls as dangerous mountain dwellers
They spent the morning trolling for salmon
Troll fishing works best at slow speeds

definitions: wheeled cart for carrying shopping, luggage, or serving food
electric streetcar running on tracks for public transportation
examples: Push the shopping trolley to the checkout counter
The tea trolley rolled through the hospital ward
San Francisco's trolleys remain popular with tourists
The trolley line connected downtown with the suburbs

definitions: act of posting provocative messages online to upset others
fishing method where lines are drawn through water
examples: Trolling violates most social media community guidelines
His constant trolling got him banned from the forum
Trolling for tuna requires patience and proper equipment
We spent hours trolling without catching anything

definitions: large brass wind instrument with sliding tube for changing pitch
examples: The trombone section added depth to the jazz ensemble
Learning trombone requires mastering the slide positions

definitions: person who plays the trombone professionally or as hobby
examples: The lead trombonist performed an amazing solo
Famous jazz trombonists influenced generations of musicians

definitions: group of soldiers or armed forces personnel
local group of scouts or similar youth organization
examples: The troop marched in formation across the parade ground
Additional troops were deployed to the region
Her daughter joined the Girl Scout troop last year
The troop earned badges for community service

definitions: state police officer especially one patrolling highways
soldier in cavalry or armored unit
person who perseveres despite difficulties without complaining
examples: The state trooper issued a speeding ticket
Highway troopers responded to the accident quickly
The cavalry trooper maintained his horse expertly
Troopers advanced across the battlefield
She's a real trooper working through her illness
What a trooper, never complaining despite the pain
